title: E0609's "one of the expressions' fields has a field of the same name" suggestion does not consider privacy

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-incorrect
labels.description: A diagnostic that is giving misleading or incorrect information

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur. 
-->
https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=d65d484826fe6e0d2d490ee1fa63052e
Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
mod lib {
    #[derive(Default)]
    pub struct Xyz { x: f32, y: f32, z: f32 }
    #[derive(Default)]
    pub struct Vec3(Xyz);
}

fn main() {
    let a: lib::Vec3 = Default::default();
    println!("{}", a.x);
}
```

The current output is:

```rust
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0609]: no field `x` on type `Vec3`
  --> src/main.rs:10:22
   |
10 |     println!("{}", a.x);
   |                      ^
   |
help: one of the expressions' fields has a field of the same name
   |
10 |     println!("{}", a.0.x);
   |                      ^^
help: a field with a similar name exists
   |
10 |     println!("{}", a.0);
   |                      ^

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0609`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->
The suggested fixes, `a.0` and `a.0.x` both refer to a private field, so they do not compile..

Given the following code, having implemented the suggested change:
```rust
mod lib {
    #[derive(Default)]
    pub struct Xyz { x: f32, y: f32, z: f32 }
    #[derive(Default)]
    pub struct Vec3(Xyz);
}

fn main() {
    let a: lib::Vec3 = Default::default();
    println!("{}", a.0.x);
}
```

The output is, correctly:
```rust
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0616]: field `0` of struct `Vec3` is private
  --> src/main.rs:10:22
   |
10 |     println!("{}", a.0.x);
   |                      ^ private field

error[E0616]: field `x` of struct `Xyz` is private
  --> src/main.rs:10:24
   |
10 |     println!("{}", a.0.x);
   |                        ^ private field

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0616`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
